original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yid la byas pa dang / @287a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yid la byas pa dang / @287a * //
translated: and thought of the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de nyid du tshe'i dus byas kyang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i nang du skyes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid du tshe'i dus byas kyang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i nang du skyes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Even though she died right there, she was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: da ltar gyi sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sangs rgyas mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on the Concentration Which Perceives the Buddha of the Present Face to Face also says:

original: nam zhig de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong ba dang / des gsungs pa'i chos kyi sgra thos par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon gsungs so //
analyzed: nam zhig de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du mthong ba dang / des gsungs pa'i chos kyi sgra thos par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i phan yon gsungs so //
translated: “When will I see the Tathāgata face to face and hear the Dharma that he teaches?”

original: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa las /
translated: The noble Inquiry of Rāṣṭrapāla says,

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yang yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yang yin par gsungs so //
translated: “It is the recollection of the Buddha.”

original: de ltar mdo de dag de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la bsgoms na phan yon che bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar mdo de dag de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la bsgoms na phan yon che bar gsungs so //
translated: Thus, those sūtras say that meditating on the body of the Tathāgata in those ways has great benefits.

original: dmigs pa la dang ba'am dad pa skye ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la dang ba'am dad pa skye ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the need for faith or confidence in the object?🔽It is said that the first of the eight formative factors that abandon the five faults is the faith of conviction,

original: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyi dang po mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa yin par gsungs pa dang / dad pa sngon 'dren ma ltar skyes pa ste //
analyzed: nyes pa lnga spang ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyi dang po mngon par yid ches pa'i dad pa yin par gsungs pa dang / dad pa sngon 'dren ma ltar skyes pa ste //
translated: and that faith is the leader, like a mother,

original: lag pa bzhin du dge sdud rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: lag pa bzhin du dge sdud rtsa ba yin //
translated: and like a hand, the root of gathering virtue.

original: zhes gsungs pas dad pa skye ba'i yul gal che'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas dad pa skye ba'i yul gal che'o //
translated: Therefore, the object that produces faith is very important.

original: de bas na phan yon che ba dang / dad pa skye ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs brnyan gang la mos pa cig la 'khar ba dang ra gan la sogs pa'i 'du shes mi skyed par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag bsags pa las 'bras bu khyad par can
analyzed: de bas na phan yon che ba dang / dad pa skye ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs brnyan gang la mos pa cig la 'khar ba dang ra gan la sogs pa'i 'du shes mi skyed par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' dag bsags pa las 'bras bu khyad par can
translated: Therefore, since it is the field for generating faith and has great benefits, you should not generate the conception of a staff or brass, etc.🔽toward any image of the body of the Tathagata, but rather think, “This is the body of exalted wisdom and merit, which is the special result of the accumulation of all the collections of merit and exalted wisdom.”

original: ye shes dang bcas pa'i sku 'di lta bu bskyed pa yin snyam du bsams la dbyibs kyi bye brag bzhugs thabs sam /
analyzed: ye shes dang bcas pa'i sku 'di lta bu bskyed pa yin snyam du bsams la dbyibs kyi bye brag bzhugs thabs sam /
translated: Think that and look at the particular shape, the posture,🔽the upper body, the lower body, the head, the hands, the feet, the back, the seat, the hand implements, the ornaments, etc.,

original: sku stod dang sku smad dang / dbu dang phyag dang / zhabs dang / rgyab yol dang / gdan khri dang / phyag mtshan dang / rgyan la sogs pa ji ltar gnas pa dang / kha dog gi bye brag ser po'am /
analyzed: sku stod dang sku smad dang / dbu dang phyag dang / zhabs dang / rgyab yol dang / gdan khri dang / phyag mtshan dang / rgyan la sogs pa ji ltar gnas pa dang / kha dog gi bye brag ser po'am /
translated: just as they are, and the particular colors, such as yellow,

original: dmar po la sogs pa kha dog gcig pa'am /
analyzed: dmar po la sogs pa kha dog gcig pa'am /
translated: red, etc., whether they are the same or not.

original: mi gcig pa la legs par blta zhing nyi ma gnyis gsum du skabs skabs su bskyed cing blta /
analyzed: mi gcig pa la legs par blta zhing nyi ma gnyis gsum du skabs skabs su bskyed cing blta /
translated: Look at them well and generate them and look at them from time to time for two or three days.

original: 'dud cing rtags bye brag chung ngu yan chad sems la gzung shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dud cing rtags bye brag chung ngu yan chad sems la gzung shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand the mind, from the smallest to the most distinguished, by means of the knowledge that apprehends the mind.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the characteristics of the object of meditation.

original: sngon du 'gro ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the preliminary practice?

original: dang por bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dang por bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: First, one should complete all activities.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i sa phyogs su phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas stan bde ba'i steng du 'dug ste /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i sa phyogs su phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa sngon du song bas stan bde ba'i steng du 'dug ste /
translated: Having gone to a pleasant place, and having performed prostrations and so forth, one should sit on a comfortable seat.

original: lus bags kyis glod la drang por bsrangs /
analyzed: lus bags kyis glod la drang por bsrangs /
translated: One should relax the body a little and straighten it up.

original: skyil mo @287b krung dal bus bca'/
analyzed: skyil mo @287b krung dal bus bca'/
translated: One should slowly sit cross-legged.

original: lus la skyo ba bskyed de 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: lus la skyo ba bskyed de 'dug par bya'o //
translated: One should sit, generating weariness with the body.

original: de nas 'di snyam du bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di snyam du bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should think as follows:

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i me rab tu 'bar bas sreg cing gzung ste 'khor zhing rab tu sdug bsngal lo snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i me rab tu 'bar bas sreg cing gzung ste 'khor zhing rab tu sdug bsngal lo snyam du bsam mo //
translated: “All beings are burned by the blazing fire of birth, old age, sickness, and death. They are seized and wander around, suffering greatly.”

original: de skad du ;
analyzed: de skad du ;
translated: It is said like this:

original: 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa rgya cher rol pa las /
translated: In the noble extensive sutra,

original: srid gsum rga dang nad kyi sdug bsngal 'bar //
analyzed: srid gsum rga dang nad kyi sdug bsngal 'bar //
translated: The three worlds are ablaze with the suffering of sickness and old age.

original: 'chi me rab 'bar 'di na mgon med pa //
analyzed: 'chi me rab 'bar 'di na mgon med pa //
translated: The fire of death is blazing. Here there is no protector.

original: srid las 'byung las 'gro ba rtag tu rmongs //
analyzed: srid las 'byung las 'gro ba rtag tu rmongs //
translated: From existence, the means of release is always unknown to the world,

original: bum par chud pa'i bung ba 'khor ba bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bum par chud pa'i bung ba 'khor ba bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Like a bee caught in a jar.

original: de lta bas na srid pa gsum gyi sems can thams cad srid pa las 'byung ba'i thabs ni mi shes shing 'jug par dka' la 'khor ba'i rgyu la ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta bas na srid pa gsum gyi sems can thams cad srid pa las 'byung ba'i thabs ni mi shes shing 'jug par dka' la 'khor ba'i rgyu la ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, all sentient beings in the three worlds do not know the means of release from existence, and it is difficult to enter. They naturally enter into the cause of cyclic existence.

original: de bas na bdag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byas la /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byas la /
translated: Therefore, I will attain the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag byang chub chen po la dgod do snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag byang chub chen po la dgod do snyam du bsam mo //
translated: I will establish all beings in the world in great awakening.🔽That wisdom of omniscience is attained through cultivating serenity and insight.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong goms pa las thob po zhes 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grol pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong goms pa las thob po zhes 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grol pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the noble Unraveling of the Intention.

original: de yang sngon du zhi gnas goms par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de yang sngon du zhi gnas goms par bya dgos te /
translated: Moreover, you must first cultivate serenity.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom //🔽shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob nas shes rab shin tu bsgom // shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //
translated: Having attained the meditative concentrations, one should cultivate wisdom well.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Through wisdom, one attains the purity of intuition.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: And the noble Ten Stages also says,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas skye'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas skye'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The intuition of omniscience arises in dependence on meditative concentration.”

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las kyang /
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las kyang /
translated: And the Compendium of Training says,

original: srid la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' yas mi bzad pa //
analyzed: srid la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' yas mi bzad pa //
translated: “The infinite, unbearable sufferings of cyclic existence,

original: sems yid ma zhi khyed kyis yang dang yang myong gyur //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sems yid ma zhi khyed kyis yang dang yang myong gyur // ces gsungs so //
translated: you have experienced them again and again, with an agitated, unpeaceful mind.”

original: spyod pa la 'jug pa las kyang /
analyzed: spyod pa la 'jug pa las kyang /
translated: And the Guide to the Bodhisattva Way of Life also says,

original: yid ni rnam par g-yengs gyur na //🔽nyon mongs mche ba'i phrag na gnas //
analyzed: yid ni rnam par g-yengs gyur na // nyon mongs mche ba'i phrag na gnas //
translated: “When the mind is distracted,

original: zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: it dwells in the jaws of the afflictions.”

original: / de lta bas na bdag gi thog mar zhi gnas bsgrub po snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: / de lta bas na bdag gi thog mar zhi gnas bsgrub po snyam du bsam mo //
translated: Therefore, think, “I will first accomplish serenity.”

original: de ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: This is the preliminary.

original: sems ji ltar gtad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems ji ltar gtad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the attention that is focused?

original: gong du legs par brtags pa'i sku de bdag gi mdun logs su khru gang gi pha mtha' tsam na sngar brtags pa bas kyang dbyibs legs @288a * //
analyzed: gong du legs par brtags pa'i sku de bdag gi mdun logs su khru gang gi pha mtha' tsam na sngar brtags pa bas kyang dbyibs legs @288a * //
translated: The body that was well examined above is placed in front of oneself, about one cubit away, and one focuses on it with intense concentration, thinking, “Is the shape better than before?

original: sam kha dog gsal lam snyam du rdzogs pa mtshan nyid ci gsal du shes pa rab tu bsgrims la gtad do //
analyzed: sam kha dog gsal lam snyam du rdzogs pa mtshan nyid ci gsal du shes pa rab tu bsgrims la gtad do //
translated: Is the color clearer?”

original: de ltar gtad tsam na ye mi snang na yang rdzogs pa kho nar bsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar gtad tsam na ye mi snang na yang rdzogs pa kho nar bsam mo //
translated: If it does not appear at all when one focuses in this way, one should imagine that it is complete.

original: bye brag cung zad tsam snang na yang rab tu bsgrims la bzung ngo //
analyzed: bye brag cung zad tsam snang na yang rab tu bsgrims la bzung ngo //
translated: If only a few details appear, one should focus on them with intense concentration.

original: yang mi snang na rdzogs pa kho nar zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: yang mi snang na rdzogs pa kho nar zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: If they do not appear, one should imagine that the complete form is present.

original: de bas rdzogs par ci gsal du bsgom zhing rdzogs par mi snang na bye brag cung zad snang yang de la gtad /
analyzed: de bas rdzogs par ci gsal du bsgom zhing rdzogs par mi snang na bye brag cung zad snang yang de la gtad /
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the complete form as clearly as possible. If the complete form does not appear, one should focus on the few details that do appear.

original: de snang ma thag tu yang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du sems rab tu bsgrims la gtad do //
analyzed: de snang ma thag tu yang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du sems rab tu bsgrims la gtad do //
translated: As soon as they appear, one should focus on them with intense concentration, imagining that they have the characteristics of a complete form.

original: de bas na gtso cher spyi la bsgom zhing bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na gtso cher spyi la bsgom zhing bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, one should mainly cultivate the general, and only later should one cultivate the particular.

original: gzhan dag na re shes pa bsgrims ci dgos tha mal par gzhag pas chog mod zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes pa bsgrims ci dgos tha mal par gzhag pas chog mod zer te /
translated: Others say: What is the use of tightening the mind? It is sufficient to rest in a natural way.

original: las dang po pas ni de ltar mi bya ste /
analyzed: las dang po pas ni de ltar mi bya ste /
translated: But a beginner should not do it that way.

original: slob dpon thogs med kyi zhal snga nas bsam gtan rnams la yid la byed pa bdun gyis 'jug pa ni bzhis bsdus te /
analyzed: slob dpon thogs med kyi zhal snga nas bsam gtan rnams la yid la byed pa bdun gyis 'jug pa ni bzhis bsdus te /
translated: The master Asatiga says: One enters the meditative stabilities by means of seven attentions, which are included in four:🔽tightly focused attention, interrupted attention, uninterrupted attention, and spontaneous attention.

original: bsgrims te 'jug pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs te de bas na las dang po pas shes pa rab tu bsgrims la dmigs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: bsgrims te 'jug pa dang / skabs su 'chad cing 'jug pa dang / skabs su 'chad pa med par 'jug pa dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o zhes gsungs te de bas na las dang po pas shes pa rab tu bsgrims la dmigs pa gzung ste /
translated: Therefore, a beginner should focus the mind by tightening it, and should hold the object of meditation.

original: de ni sems ji ltar gtad pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de ni sems ji ltar gtad pa'i thabs so //
translated: That is the method for how to focus the mind.

original: nyes pa spang pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa spang pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the elimination of faults?

original: nyes pa ni skabs 'dir bying rgod gnyis la bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni skabs 'dir bying rgod gnyis la bya ba ste /
translated: In this context, faults refer to laxity and excitement.

original: gong ma bzhin du gtad pa'i skabs su sems bying ngam bying du dogs par mthong na dad pa ske ba'i yul yid la byas la shes pa gsal bar gyur ma thag tu gong ma bzhin du gtad do //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du gtad pa'i skabs su sems bying ngam bying du dogs par mthong na dad pa ske ba'i yul yid la byas la shes pa gsal bar gyur ma thag tu gong ma bzhin du gtad do //
translated: As above, when you are directing your attention to the object, if you see that your mind is dull or is tending to dullness, then bring to mind an object that engenders faith. As soon as your mind becomes clear, direct your attention to the object as before.

original: bying ba'i rgyu ni kha zas kyi bye brag dang / ngal dub dang / mun pa yid la byas pa la sogs pas dmigs ba gsal bar 'dzin mi nus so //
analyzed: bying ba'i rgyu ni kha zas kyi bye brag dang / ngal dub dang / mun pa yid la byas pa la sogs pas dmigs ba gsal bar 'dzin mi nus so //
translated: The causes of dullness are certain types of food, fatigue, and bringing to mind darkness and so on.

original: rgod pa ni gong ma bzhin du gtad tsam na dmigs pa de las gzhan gang dran yang rgod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgod pa ni gong ma bzhin du gtad tsam na dmigs pa de las gzhan gang dran yang rgod pa yin te /
translated: Excitement is as above. As soon as you direct your attention to the object, if you recall something other than that object, that is excitement.

original: dran ma thag tu skyo ba bskyed cing dmigs pa gang yin pa la myur du gtad do //
analyzed: dran ma thag tu skyo ba bskyed cing dmigs pa gang yin pa la myur du gtad do //
translated: As soon as you are aware of it, generate a sense of disenchantment and quickly direct your attention to the object.

original: rgod pa'i rgyu ni phal cher chags pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgod pa'i rgyu ni phal cher chags pa las 'byung ste /
translated: The causes of excitement are for the most part desire and attachment.

original: de bas na mi rtag par bsam zhing skyo ba bskyed pas yul la ldog go //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag par bsam zhing skyo ba bskyed pas yul la ldog go //
translated: Therefore, by reflecting on impermanence and generating a sense of disenchantment, you turn away from objects.

original: sgom pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis bying ba ni shas chung ste /
analyzed: sgom pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis bying ba ni shas chung ste /
translated: Because your meditation is of short duration, dullness is less of a problem.

original: rgod pa las bla na pa la rab tu 'bad do //
analyzed: rgod pa las bla na pa la rab tu 'bad do //
translated: One should strive to overcome agitation.

original: sems gnas nas phyis skyed 'dod tsam na ni @288b sgom pa'i rim par gsungs pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sems gnas nas phyis skyed 'dod tsam na ni @288b sgom pa'i rim par gsungs pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: After the mind has been stabilized, one should practice as taught in the stages of meditation, when one wishes to generate it.

original: mdor na bying na gsal bar bya /
analyzed: mdor na bying na gsal bar bya /
translated: In brief, if one is sinking, one should clarify.

original: rgod na bla na /
analyzed: rgod na bla na /
translated: If one is agitated, one should calm.

original: mnyam par zhugs na yid glod de /
analyzed: mnyam par zhugs na yid glod de /
translated: When one is engaged in equipoise, one should relax the mind.

original: de ltar nyes pa spang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar nyes pa spang ngo //
translated: In this way, one should abandon faults.

original: khams kyi tshod gzung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams kyi tshod gzung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of one's constitution?

original: khams rab kyis nyin gyi bzhi cha mtshan gyi bzhi cha la thun bzhi'am lnga /
analyzed: khams rab kyis nyin gyi bzhi cha mtshan gyi bzhi cha la thun bzhi'am lnga /
translated: The best meditator practices four or five sessions during the day and four or five sessions during the night, each session being one-fourth of the day or night.

original: mtshan gyi bzhi cha ni nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la thun bzhi'am lngar bsgom mo //
analyzed: mtshan gyi bzhi cha ni nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la thun bzhi'am lngar bsgom mo //
translated: The four or five sessions during the night are practiced during the first and last parts of the night.

original: 'bring gis nyin gyi bzhi cha la thun lnga'am drug tu bsgom mo //🔽tha mas nyin gyi lnga 'am /
analyzed: 'bring gis nyin gyi bzhi cha la thun lnga'am drug tu bsgom mo // tha mas nyin gyi lnga 'am /
translated: The medium meditator practices five or six sessions during the day.

original: drug cha tsam la thun drug gam bdun tsam du bsgom mo //
analyzed: drug cha tsam la thun drug gam bdun tsam du bsgom mo //
translated: The least meditator practices six or seven sessions during the day.

original: khams zhan cing thun mang ba ni thung bas bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: khams zhan cing thun mang ba ni thung bas bye brag tu byas pa yin no //
translated: The weak constitution and many sessions are distinguished by their brevity.

original: rab kyis ni zan re bza' ran tsam /
analyzed: rab kyis ni zan re bza' ran tsam /
translated: The best meditator eats just enough for one meal.

original: 'bring dang tha mas ni gom pa tha mal pas mda' rgyang gcig gam gsum mam gnyis sam phyin pa'i bar tsam du bsgoms te de ni spyir btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring dang tha mas ni gom pa tha mal pas mda' rgyang gcig gam gsum mam gnyis sam phyin pa'i bar tsam du bsgoms te de ni spyir btang ba'o //
translated: The average and the least [advanced] should meditate for the distance of one arrow shot or three arrow shots or two arrow shots with ordinary steps. That is the general [practice].

original: de kun gyis kyang yun thung bar bsgom zhing /
analyzed: de kun gyis kyang yun thung bar bsgom zhing /
translated: All of them should meditate for a short time.

original: de'i phyi de nyin par gnyis /
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyin par gnyis /
translated: The next day, [meditate] for two [sessions].

original: de bzhin du zhag bcu'i bar du nyin re thun re bsnan cing bsgoms na /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhag bcu'i bar du nyin re thun re bsnan cing bsgoms na /
translated: In that way, increasing the sessions by one each day, meditate for ten days.

original: snga dro phyi ma red gang bde ba dang / khams rab 'bring gi tshod zhar la shes par 'ong ngo /
analyzed: snga dro phyi ma red gang bde ba dang / khams rab 'bring gi tshod zhar la shes par 'ong ngo /
translated: It will come naturally to know the measure of the best, average, and least [progress] in the morning and evening, whichever is convenient.

original: mi bde ba phran tshegs tsam yang tshor bar bya zhing zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi bde ba phran tshegs tsam yang tshor bar bya zhing zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Even slight discomfort should be felt and pacified.

original: de ltar na khams kyi tshod gzung ngo //🔽ngal gso ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar na khams kyi tshod gzung ngo // ngal gso ba'am /
translated: In that way, the measure of the elements is grasped.

original: mi bsgom pa'i skabs su ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi bsgom pa'i skabs su ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done at the time of resting or not meditating?

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
translated: The mind should be perfected, livelihood should be perfected, and conduct should be perfected.

original: de la bsam pa phun sum tshos pa ni bdag dul ba la mngon par brtsan par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / gang zag gzhan gyi skyon la mi rtag pa dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa byang ba la ji ltar bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: de la bsam pa phun sum tshos pa ni bdag dul ba la mngon par brtsan par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / gang zag gzhan gyi skyon la mi rtag pa dang / 'jigs pa la sogs pa byang ba la ji ltar bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: The first of these is the attitude of being intent on self-discipline. The second is the attitude of what is to be done in regard to the faults of other persons, such as their impermanence and fearfulness.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs sbyor bsam ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs sbyor bsam ba'o //
translated: The third is the attitude of the equipment for serenity.

original: de la bdag dul ba la mngon par brtsan par bya ba'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: de la bdag dul ba la mngon par brtsan par bya ba'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The attitude of being intent on self-discipline is taught in the

original: 'phags pa drag shul can las /
analyzed: 'phags pa drag shul can las /
translated: Noble One's Lion's Roar:

original: bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ong /
analyzed: bdag ci'i phyir dgon par 'ong /
translated: Why have I come to the wilderness?

original: dgon pa na gnas pa 'ga' zhig ni dge sbyong dang bram ze ma yin te /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa 'ga' zhig ni dge sbyong dang bram ze ma yin te /
translated: Some who live in the wilderness are not ascetics or brahmins.

original: 'di na ma zhi ba /
analyzed: 'di na ma zhi ba /
translated: Here, they are not peaceful,

original: ma byang / ma sbas pa /
analyzed: ma byang / ma sbas pa /
translated: not restrained, not hidden,

original: mi brtson pa /
analyzed: mi brtson pa /
translated: not diligent, not energetic,

original: mi 'grus pa //
analyzed: mi 'grus pa //
translated: not concentrated, not liberated.

original: 'di lta ste ri dvags dang / spre'u dang / bya mang po dang / chom rkun dang / gdol ba dag kyang mang du gnas te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ri dvags dang / spre'u dang / bya mang po dang / chom rkun dang / gdol ba dag kyang mang du gnas te /
translated: There are many animals, monkeys, birds, thieves, and outcastes living here.

original: de dag ni dge sbyong gi yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dge sbyong gi yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not have the qualities of an ascetic.

original: bdag gang gi phyir dgon pa na gnas nas dge sbyong gi don de thob par @289a * //
analyzed: bdag gang gi phyir dgon pa na gnas nas dge sbyong gi don de thob par @289a * //
translated: I will live in the wilderness and attain the goal of the spiritual life.

original: bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should think, I will do it! and generate the Thought.🔽

original: gzhan yang bdag ni lam ring po nas 'dir 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag ni lam ring po nas 'dir 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, I have come here from far away, alone and without a companion.

original: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa la bskul ba'i grogs gang yang med de /
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang / nyes par byas pa la bskul ba'i grogs gang yang med de /
translated: There is no one at all to encourage me to do what is good or to warn me about what is wrong.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / bri za dang ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag gzhan gyi sems shes pa yod de /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / bri za dang ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag gzhan gyi sems shes pa yod de /
translated: There are gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and the blessed buddhas who know the minds of others.

original: bdag dgon pa na gnas na mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na de dag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dgon pa na gnas na mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du song na de dag gi dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If I live in the wilderness and fall under the influence of unwholesome thoughts, they will know it.

original: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med la nga'i ba med pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa yin la gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: bdag lam ring po nas 'ongs shing gcig pu gnyis su med la nga'i ba med pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa yin la gal te 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa'am /
translated: I have come here from far away, alone and without a companion, without anyone to encourage me, and without any possessions.🔽If I have thoughts of desire,

original: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'am /
translated: thoughts of malice,

original: 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du gyur na /
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i sems kyi dbang du gyur na /
translated: If you come under the influence of nonvirtuous thoughts such as thoughts of violence,

original: 'du 'dzi ba'am 'du 'dzi la gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi ba'am 'du 'dzi la gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang bye brag med par 'gyur la /
translated: you will be no different from sentient beings who are involved in worldly activities.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang dri za rnams kyang bslus par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang dri za rnams kyang bslus par 'gyur zhing /
translated: You will deceive the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi mnyes par byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mi mnyes par byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: You will displease the blessed buddhas.

original: de bas na bdag ci nas lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi dgyes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag ci nas lha rnams 'phya bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi dgyes par mi 'gyur ba de ltar sems bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, you should think, “I will generate my mind in such a way that I will not be criticized by the gods and I will not displease the blessed buddhas.”🔽Do not examine the faults of others.

original: gzhan gyi skyon la mi brtag pa ni 'di skad du mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skyon la mi brtag pa ni 'di skad du mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Requested by Sagaramati says:

original: yon tan 'od pa nags na gnas pa dag / pha rol dag gi skyon la brtag mi bya //
analyzed: yon tan 'od pa nags na gnas pa dag / pha rol dag gi skyon la brtag mi bya //
translated: Those who live in the forest, shining with good qualities, do not examine the faults of others.

original: bdag ni khyad par 'phags shing bdag mchog ces //
analyzed: bdag ni khyad par 'phags shing bdag mchog ces //
translated: “I am superior” or “I am the best”

original: de snyam du ni sems bskyed mi bya'o //
analyzed: de snyam du ni sems bskyed mi bya'o //
translated: you should not generate such thoughts.

original: rgyags ni bag med kun gyi rtsa ba ste //
analyzed: rgyags ni bag med kun gyi rtsa ba ste //
translated: Arrogance is the root of all heedlessness.

original: dge sbyong dman la brnyas par ma byed cig / bskal pa gcig gis byang chub thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dge sbyong dman la brnyas par ma byed cig / bskal pa gcig gis byang chub thob mi 'gyur //
translated: Do not despise the lowly ascetic, for enlightenment is not attained in a single life.

original: 'di ni bstan pa 'di la go rims yin //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa 'di la go rims yin //
translated: This is the order in this teaching.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Multitude of Jewels, it says,

original: phya rol gyi skyon la rtogs pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phya rol gyi skyon la rtogs pa ni dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “To think about the faults of others is an improper mental activity for those living in the forest.”

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa la sogs pa byung na snying rje chen po bskyed do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa la sogs pa byung na snying rje chen po bskyed do //
translated: If you are frightened by nonhuman beings, arouse great compassion.

original: des zhi bar 'gyur bar mdo sde las gsungs so //
analyzed: des zhi bar 'gyur bar mdo sde las gsungs so //
translated: It is said in the sūtras that they will be pacified.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs spyir bsam pa ni gong du smos pa rnams skabs skabs su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs spyir bsam pa ni gong du smos pa rnams skabs skabs su bsam par bya'o //
translated: The general collection for serenity should be reflected upon from time to time, as mentioned above.

original: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rab tu byung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rab tu byung ba yin na /
translated: If you are a renunciant, you have the perfect livelihood.

original: mthar @289b chags kyi bsod snyoms dang / rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa gang yang rung bas dang por 'dul ba'am mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du blang ba'am /
analyzed: mthar @289b chags kyi bsod snyoms dang / rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa gang yang rung bas dang por 'dul ba'am mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du blang ba'am /
translated: Whether one is a monk who goes for alms in a set order or one who is satisfied with whatever he gets, one should first take food in accordance with the scriptures on discipline or the scriptures on the bodhisattva collection.

original: sbyin bdag la gsol ba gdab pa byas la phyis 'tsho ba shin tu ngan kyang 'gyod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag la gsol ba gdab pa byas la phyis 'tsho ba shin tu ngan kyang 'gyod par mi bya ste /
translated: Or, one should request a benefactor to provide one’s livelihood. Later, even if one’s livelihood becomes very poor, one should not regret it.

original: bdag gi 'tsho ba gzhan la rag las pa yin no snyam du bsam zhing nga rgyal bskyungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi 'tsho ba gzhan la rag las pa yin no snyam du bsam zhing nga rgyal bskyungs te /
translated: One should think, “My livelihood depends on others,” and one should abandon pride.

original: lhad zan zhag bdun pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: lhad zan zhag bdun pa yang rung ste /
translated: Even if one eats bad food for seven days,

original: zas kyi ro la chags pa ni bcam ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: zas kyi ro la chags pa ni bcam ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: the Blessed One has in many ways criticized attachment to the taste of food.

original: zas la brten nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa 'di ni 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: zas la brten nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa 'di ni 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa yin no snyam du bsam mo //
translated: One should think, “I will not give rise to afflictions in dependence on food. This is the perfection of livelihood.”

original: dge bsnyen yin na yang /
analyzed: dge bsnyen yin na yang /
translated: If one is a lay practitioner,

original: kha na ma tho ba med cing khams dang 'phrod pa dang po tshags byas na phyis 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med cing khams dang 'phrod pa dang po tshags byas na phyis 'dod pa'am /
translated: one should eat food that is free of moral and religious transgressions, that is suitable to one’s constitution, and that is obtained without searching.

original: phul bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: phul bskyed pa'am /
translated: Later, one should eat what one desires,

original: tshol ba'i bsam pa mi bya bar chog shes par bya ste /
analyzed: tshol ba'i bsam pa mi bya bar chog shes par bya ste /
translated: Without the thought of seeking, one should be content.

original: ji ltar za gcig pas kyang ma thob pa thob par bya ba 'grub na /
analyzed: ji ltar za gcig pas kyang ma thob pa thob par bya ba 'grub na /
translated: If a person who eats only once a day accomplishes the goal of attaining what has not been attained,

original: bdag cag dus dang dus ma yin pa thams cad du za bas lhad zan las med kyang khams ci'i phyir mi brta /
analyzed: bdag cag dus dang dus ma yin pa thams cad du za bas lhad zan las med kyang khams ci'i phyir mi brta /
translated: why should our bodies not be strong, since we eat at all times and at the proper times, and have no more than a little food?

original: de bas zan gyi don du sdig pa bsag cing dge ba'i bar chad mi byed pa ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: de bas zan gyi don du sdig pa bsag cing dge ba'i bar chad mi byed pa ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no snyam du bsam mo //
translated: Thus, one should think that the complete purity of livelihood is not to accumulate evil for the sake of food and not to create obstacles to virtue.

original: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa ni sems mi gnas ki bar du kha ton dang / phyag mang po mi bya /
analyzed: spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa ni sems mi gnas ki bar du kha ton dang / phyag mang po mi bya /
translated: As for the complete purity of conduct, until the mind is stable, one should not recite prayers or do prostrations.

original: yi dam du bcas pa yang du bas su bcad cing nyin par phar 'gro tshur 'gro bya zhing zhar la sgra ha cang mi che bar gdon /
analyzed: yi dam du bcas pa yang du bas su bcad cing nyin par phar 'gro tshur 'gro bya zhing zhar la sgra ha cang mi che bar gdon /
translated: One should not break one's vows, but should go out and come back during the day, and in between times one should recite the mantra without making too much noise.

original: lus kyi spyod lam sos dal bar bya /
analyzed: lus kyi spyod lam sos dal bar bya /
translated: One should be slow and relaxed in one's physical behavior.

original: gyen thur zug po la mi 'gro //
analyzed: gyen thur zug po la mi 'gro //
translated: One should not go up or down steep paths.

original: sa gcig tu yun ha cang ring bar mi 'dug / nyin par glos phab ste gnyid mi log / stobs bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: sa gcig tu yun ha cang ring bar mi 'dug / nyin par glos phab ste gnyid mi log / stobs bskyed pa'am /
translated: He does not stay in one place for too long.🔽He does not lie down during the day.

original: drag shul chen po mi bya /
analyzed: drag shul chen po mi bya /
translated: He does not engage in strenuous activities.

original: spyod lam kun byang chub kyi sems kyis zin par bya ste /🔽'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: spyod lam kun byang chub kyi sems kyis zin par bya ste / 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las 'byung ba'am /
translated: He should practice all his activities while maintaining the spirit of enlightenment.🔽He should remember what is taught in the Cloud of Jewels Sutra

original: spyod yul yongs su dag pa las 'byung ba bzhin du dran par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su dag pa las 'byung ba bzhin du dran par bya'o //
translated: and in the Sutra on Pure Ethical Conduct.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dge ba la ni las dang sems 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba la ni las dang sems 'jug par bya ste /
translated: he should apply himself to virtuous actions and thoughts.

original: mi nus na btang snyoms dang lung du ma bstan pas ngal bso'o //
analyzed: mi nus na btang snyoms dang lung du ma bstan pas ngal bso'o //
translated: If he is unable to do that, he should rest in equanimity and in ethically neutral activities.

original: mi dge ba'i sems cung zad kyang mi btang ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems cung zad kyang mi btang ste /
translated: He should not give in to even the slightest nonvirtuous thought.

original: 'dus shing kha stobs 'gyed pa dang / rgyal po dang / bud med la sogs pa gtam ngan pa smra ba'am /
analyzed: 'dus shing kha stobs 'gyed pa dang / rgyal po dang / bud med la sogs pa gtam ngan pa smra ba'am /
translated: He should not engage in idle talk, such as political discussions,

original: ngan pa'i rtog pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: ngan pa'i rtog pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed do //
translated: or in any unwholesome thoughts.

original: gong du bstan pa bzhin du sngon du 'gro ba dang / smon lam ci rigs par cung @290a * //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa bzhin du sngon du 'gro ba dang / smon lam ci rigs par cung @290a * //
translated: As explained above, he should perform the preliminaries and make whatever aspirational prayers are appropriate.

original: zad la gdab pa ni las dang po pas nyin re la thun re tsam bya ste /
analyzed: zad la gdab pa ni las dang po pas nyin re la thun re tsam bya ste /
translated: The casting of the seed of exhaustion is done by the beginner, who does it once a day,

original: sgom res kyis mi bya'o //
analyzed: sgom res kyis mi bya'o //
translated: but not in every meditation session.

original: de dag ni mi bsgom pa'i dus kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mi bsgom pa'i dus kyi bya ba'o //
translated: Those are the activities at the time of not meditating.

original: bsgom pas sems kyi skye lugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pas sems kyi skye lugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The way the mind arises through meditation is of two kinds:

original: cig car dang rim gyis so //
analyzed: cig car dang rim gyis so //
translated: all at once and in stages.

original: gong ma la gnyis te /🔽thun gcig nas zhag bdun tshun chad kyis cig car rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa sal gyis snang nas brtan pa dang / thun gcig tsam snang nas zhag kha cig mi snang ste /
analyzed: gong ma la gnyis te / thun gcig nas zhag bdun tshun chad kyis cig car rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa sal gyis snang nas brtan pa dang / thun gcig tsam snang nas zhag kha cig mi snang ste /
translated: The former is of two kinds:🔽The first is the appearance of the complete arising all at once in one session up to seven days, whether the effort is strong or weak, and then stabilizing.

original: cis kyang cig car du rdzogs par snang nas brtan pa'o //
analyzed: cis kyang cig car du rdzogs par snang nas brtan pa'o //
translated: The second is the appearance of the complete arising all at once in one session, and then stabilizing.

original: rim gyis pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: rim gyis pa la bzhi ste /
translated: The latter is of four kinds:

original: dang po rtsol ba drag kyang rung zhan yang rung dmigs ba cung zad kyang mi snang ba'i nyams dang / de nas rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na snang la /
analyzed: dang po rtsol ba drag kyang rung zhan yang rung dmigs ba cung zad kyang mi snang ba'i nyams dang / de nas rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na snang la /
translated: The first is the experience of not seeing any appearance of the object of meditation, whether the effort is strong or weak.

original: skabs skabs su drag zhan gnyi ga la mi snang ba'i nyams dang / drag tu bsgoms na ni snang la /
analyzed: skabs skabs su drag zhan gnyi ga la mi snang ba'i nyams dang / drag tu bsgoms na ni snang la /
translated: Sometimes, in both the strong and weak [meditations], there is an experience of non-appearance.🔽If one meditates strongly, [the object] appears.🔽If one meditates otherwise, sometimes it does not appear.

original: gzhan du bsgoms na skabs kha cig tu mi snang ba dang / rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba la sogs pa gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du bsgoms na skabs kha cig tu mi snang ba dang / rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba la sogs pa gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the object of desire appear in both the strong and weak [meditations].

original: yang kha cig la 'di ltar skye ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig la 'di ltar skye ste /
translated: Again, it arises for some like this:

original: thog ma nyid la rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la mi snang ba mi srid de /
analyzed: thog ma nyid la rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la mi snang ba mi srid de /
translated: From the very beginning, it is impossible that [the object] does not appear in both the strong and weak [meditations].

original: phyogs re tsam snang ste rdzogs par mi snang du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: phyogs re tsam snang ste rdzogs par mi snang du mi 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that it appears in one direction, but not that it does not appear completely.🔽Whatever is clear, focus on that.

original: gang gsal ba la gtad cing de mi gsal tsam na rangs pa la gtad /
analyzed: gang gsal ba la gtad cing de mi gsal tsam na rangs pa la gtad /
translated: When that is not clear, focus on what is clear.

original: yang phyogs gcig gsal na de la gtad de mi gsal na yang snga ma bzhin du byas pas gsal tshabs je che je tshe brten skyed byung na rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan🔽pa'o // yang kha cig la thog ma nyid nas rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la re 'ga' sang /
analyzed: yang phyogs gcig gsal na de la gtad de mi gsal na yang snga ma bzhin du byas pas gsal tshabs je che je tshe brten skyed byung na rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o // yang kha cig la thog ma nyid nas rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la re 'ga' sang /
translated: Also, if it is clear in one direction, focus on that. If it is not clear, do as before. If it arises with increasing clarity, it has the characteristics of being focused on both strong and weak exertion.🔽Some have the experience that it sometimes appears with both strong and weak exertion and sometimes it does not appear at all.

original: res 'ga' mi snang ba'i nyams dang / cung zad skyed byung nas rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la phal cher snang la gnas skabs kha cig tu mi snang ba'i nyams dang rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' mi snang ba'i nyams dang / cung zad skyed byung nas rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la phal cher snang la gnas skabs kha cig tu mi snang ba'i nyams dang rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang ste /
translated: When it arises a little, it appears with both strong and weak exertion, but it does not appear at all times.🔽When it is cultivated with weak exertion, it does not appear at all times.

original: rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms na kha cig tu mi snang ba'i nyams dang / rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms na kha cig tu mi snang ba'i nyams dang / rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the characteristics of being focused on both strong and weak exertion.

original: yang kha cig la sems kyi skye lugs 'das ma thag pa dang 'dra ba las skye ba'i rim pa gsum pa rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la snang /
analyzed: yang kha cig la sems kyi skye lugs 'das ma thag pa dang 'dra ba las skye ba'i rim pa gsum pa rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la snang /

analyzed: skabs kha cig tu gzhan du @290b bsgoms na ma snang ba 'byung ba'i skabs der ma nges pa lnga snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: nates may arise.

original: dbyibs ma nges pa dang / kha dog ma nges pa dang / kha dog 'ba' zhig dang / grangs dang / che chung ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ma nges pa dang / kha dog ma nges pa dang / kha dog 'ba' zhig dang / grangs dang / che chung ma nges pa'o //
translated: The five are indeterminate shape, indeterminate color, only color, number, and indeterminate size.

original: de la dbyibs ma nges pa ni /
analyzed: de la dbyibs ma nges pa ni /
translated: Indeterminate shape is as follows.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs snang bar 'dod pa la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs snang bar 'dod pa la /
translated: When one wishes to see the form of the Sugata,

analyzed: sku mi snang bar mchod rten nam /
translated: the form does not appear, but a stūpa or

original: gzhan zlum po la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan zlum po la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: something else, such as a circle, appears.

original: kha dog ma nges pa ni ser por snang bar 'dod pa la sngon po'am dmar po la sogs pa gzhan snang ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog ma nges pa ni ser por snang bar 'dod pa la sngon po'am dmar po la sogs pa gzhan snang ba'o //
translated: Indeterminate color is when one wishes to see yellow, but something else appears, such as blue or red.

original: kha dog 'ba' zhig pa ni dbyibs dang kha dog bcas par 'dod pa las dbyibs kyi tha snyad ni gdags par dka'/
analyzed: kha dog 'ba' zhig pa ni dbyibs dang kha dog bcas par 'dod pa las dbyibs kyi tha snyad ni gdags par dka'/
translated: The color-only is the color and shape together.

original: ser po la sogs pa 'od du snang ba'o //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa 'od du snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of light such as yellow, etc.

original: grangs ma nges pa ni gcig bsgoms na gnyis yan chad snang ba'o //
analyzed: grangs ma nges pa ni gcig bsgoms na gnyis yan chad snang ba'o //
translated: The indeterminate number is when one is cultivated and two or more appear.

original: che chung ma nges pa ni chen po bsgoms pa ni chung ngu snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: che chung ma nges pa ni chen po bsgoms pa ni chung ngu snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The indeterminate size is when the great is cultivated and the small appears, etc.

original: ma nges pa de dag las thun gcig la yang gnyis snang ba dang / gsum dang bzhi gang zag gcig la snang ba srid kyi lnga kho na thun gcig la snang ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: ma nges pa de dag las thun gcig la yang gnyis snang ba dang / gsum dang bzhi gang zag gcig la snang ba srid kyi lnga kho na thun gcig la snang ba ni mi srid do //
translated: From among those indeterminates, it is possible that two, three, or four appear in one session to one person, but it is impossible that five appear in one session.

original: kha dog 'ba' zhig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog 'ba' zhig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts the color-only.

original: kha dog 'ba' zhig la yang sngar gyi sku'i kha dog dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha dog 'ba' zhig la yang sngar gyi sku'i kha dog dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: Also, in the color-only, the color of the body is either in accord with the previous or not in accord.

original: thams cad la nag por snang ba ni khams mi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la nag por snang ba ni khams mi bde ba yin no //
translated: The appearance of everything as black is an unhealthy element.

original: ci'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called indeterminate?

original: skye ba'i rim pa gsum pa'i skabs su de dag gang yang ma nges pas na ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa gsum pa'i skabs su de dag gang yang ma nges pas na ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are not ascertained at the time of the third stage of arising, they are called “uncertain.”

original: skabs der de dag gi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: skabs der de dag gi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya ste /
translated: At that time, one should not follow them.

original: sngar brtags pa'i sku nyid la bsgom mo //
analyzed: sngar brtags pa'i sku nyid la bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the body that was previously examined.

original: gzhan ni gsal bar 'dra yang gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyi dang mi ldan pas rjes su mi 'brang ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni gsal bar 'dra yang gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyi dang mi ldan pas rjes su mi 'brang ste /
translated: Although others are similar in clarity, since they do not have the characteristics of the desired object, one should not follow them.

original: khams la gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams la gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they oppress the elements.

original: rjes su ma 'brang bas skyed byung ste /
analyzed: rjes su ma 'brang bas skyed byung ste /
translated: Since one does not follow them, they arise.

original: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba la sogs gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Since both strong and weak effort appear to be complete, they have the characteristics of the desired object.

original: gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma nges pa la yang bstan pa'i thabs bya'o //
analyzed: gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma nges pa la yang bstan pa'i thabs bya'o //
translated: One should employ the method of teaching even to the uncertain ones who have the characteristics of the desired object.

original: phyis gang mos pa la gyur du 'dod do //
analyzed: phyis gang mos pa la gyur du 'dod do //
translated: Later, one should allow them to do whatever they like.

original: cig car ba dang rim gyis pa de dag gi gnas pa'i tshad ni mtshan nyid bzhi yin la /
analyzed: cig car ba dang rim gyis pa de dag gi gnas pa'i tshad ni mtshan nyid bzhi yin la /
translated: The measure of the duration of the practice of those who are instantaneous and those who are gradual is four characteristics.

original: gsal ba'i bye brag ni rab 'bring gsum mo //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bye brag ni rab 'bring gsum mo //
translated: The distinctions of clarity are the three: best, middling, and least.

original: de la mtshan nyid bzhi ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba dang / thun ril por gnas nus pa dang / bying rgod gnyis dang bral ba dang / lus kyi bde @291a * //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid bzhi ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la rdzogs par snang ba dang / thun ril por gnas nus pa dang / bying rgod gnyis dang bral ba dang / lus kyi bde @291a * //
translated: Among them, the four characteristics are: (1) appearing to be complete in both strong and weak effort, (2) being able to remain in a session, (3) being free from both dullness and agitation, and (4) being free from physical bliss,

original: ba spang ba dang / 'jam pa cung zad dang / sems la dga' ba dgod 'chor ba tsam dang / sems rtsa gcig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: ba spang ba dang / 'jam pa cung zad dang / sems la dga' ba dgod 'chor ba tsam dang / sems rtsa gcig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa yod pa'o //
translated: smooth, and slightly joyful, and (5) being able to place the mind in a state of one-pointedness.

original: gsal ba'i bye brag gsum ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i bye brag gsum ni /
translated: The three distinctions of clarity are:

original: rab mig gis mthong ba bas gsal zhing 'jam pa'am snyam pa dang / 'bring mngon sum du mthong ba dang 'dra snyam pa dang / tha ma cha rdzogs par gsal bar mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: rab mig gis mthong ba bas gsal zhing 'jam pa'am snyam pa dang / 'bring mngon sum du mthong ba dang 'dra snyam pa dang / tha ma cha rdzogs par gsal bar mi snang ba ste /
translated: best, thinking it is clearer and smoother than what is seen by the eyes; middling, thinking it is similar to what is seen directly; and least, not appearing clearly in complete parts.

original: de rnams gang byung yang rung chog shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams gang byung yang rung chog shes par bya ste /
translated: No matter which of those occurs, one should be satisfied.

original: re zhig de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig de bstan par bya'o //
translated: That will be explained for the time being.

original: phyis ni skyed dbyung ste /
analyzed: phyis ni skyed dbyung ste /
translated: Later, it will be generated and increased.

original: mi gsal ba gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal ba yun ring ba la sogs pa'i thabs bya'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba gsal bar bya ba dang / gsal ba yun ring ba la sogs pa'i thabs bya'o //
translated: The method of clarifying the unclear and prolonging the clear is the method of practice.

original: la lan re brten pa'i thabs mi dgos zer te /
analyzed: la lan re brten pa'i thabs mi dgos zer te /
translated: Some say that the method of support is not necessary for every session.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: brtan pa'i thabs ni bsgom pa dang ngal gso ba gnyis ka yin te /
analyzed: brtan pa'i thabs ni bsgom pa dang ngal gso ba gnyis ka yin te /
translated: The method of support is both meditation and relaxation.

original: de bas na khams kyi be brag las dpag dgos pas shin tu gces so //
analyzed: de bas na khams kyi be brag las dpag dgos pas shin tu gces so //
translated: Therefore, it is very important to determine the individual constitution.

original: khams kyi bye brag las ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: khams kyi bye brag las ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known from the individual constitution?

original: khams rab cig yin na khams mi bde ba med pa'i skabs su sems gnas pa rnyed na /
analyzed: khams rab cig yin na khams mi bde ba med pa'i skabs su sems gnas pa rnyed na /
translated: If one has the best constitution, when the mind is found to be stable in the absence of bodily discomfort,

original: nyi ma gsum mtshan mo gsum srod tho rangs dang / nyin par gsal ba 'am rtsol ba mi bya bar sngar ji tsam snang ba de ma shor bar nus tshad du bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum mtshan mo gsum srod tho rangs dang / nyin par gsal ba 'am rtsol ba mi bya bar sngar ji tsam snang ba de ma shor bar nus tshad du bsgom mo //
translated: one should meditate for as long as possible without exertion or effort, whether it is day or night, evening or dawn, or whether it is clear or not, without losing the previous experience.

original: cung zad mi bde ba'i skabs su sems gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: cung zad mi bde ba'i skabs su sems gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes stable when there is a slight bodily discomfort,

original: nyi ma gnyis dang / mtshan mo gnyis su srod dang tho rangs dang nyin par snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis dang / mtshan mo gnyis su srod dang tho rangs dang nyin par snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: Meditate in the first and last periods of the night, and during the day, as before, for two days and two nights.

original: khams 'bring gis mi bde ba med pa'i skabs su sems gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: khams 'bring gis mi bde ba med pa'i skabs su sems gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes stable during the period of comfort for one of middling faculties,

original: nyi ma gnyis dang mtshan mo gnyis su srod dang tho rangs nyin par nus chad du bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis dang mtshan mo gnyis su srod dang tho rangs nyin par nus chad du bsgom mo //
translated: meditate in the first and last periods of the night, and during the day, for two days and two nights.

original: cung zad mi bde ba'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: cung zad mi bde ba'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes stable during the period of slight discomfort for one of middling faculties,

original: nyi ma gcig dang mtshan mo gcig srod dang tho rangs nyin par snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig dang mtshan mo gcig srod dang tho rangs nyin par snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: meditate in the first and last periods of the night, and during the day, as before, for one day and one night.

original: khams tha mas mi bde ba med pa'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: khams tha mas mi bde ba med pa'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes stable during the period of comfort for one of lesser faculties,

original: nyi ma gcig dang mtshan mo gcig tu snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyi ma gcig dang mtshan mo gcig tu snga ma bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: meditate in the first and last periods of the night, and during the day, as before, for one day and one night.

original: cung zad sems mi bde ba'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: cung zad sems mi bde ba'i dus su sems gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes stable during the period of slight discomfort for one of lesser faculties,

original: thun gyi tshad ni dang po slob pa tsam du bya ste /
analyzed: thun gyi tshad ni dang po slob pa tsam du bya ste /
translated: the measure of the session is to be done just as before.

original: shes pa ni mi bsgrims par nyin mtshan gnyis tsam du bsgom mo //
analyzed: shes pa ni mi bsgrims par nyin mtshan gnyis tsam du bsgom mo //
translated: The knowledge is to meditate for two days and two nights without tightening the mind.

original: de ni sbyor btang ba ste /
analyzed: de ni sbyor btang ba ste /
translated: This is the general rule for practice.

original: gsum kas kyang nam lus ngal ba dang / shugs 'byung ba dang / dngang ba dang / mgo bags kyis lci ba dang / yang yang bying ste 'gro ba 'am nus pa byung ma thag tu 'phro bcad /
analyzed: gsum kas kyang nam lus ngal ba dang / shugs 'byung ba dang / dngang ba dang / mgo bags kyis lci ba dang / yang yang bying ste 'gro ba 'am nus pa byung ma thag tu 'phro bcad /
translated: All three should stop as soon as they feel tired, or when they feel strong, or when they feel frightened, or when their heads feel heavy, or when they feel sleepy.

original: gsum kas kyang khams cher mi bde ba dang / @291b sems gnas pa dus mtshungs par gyur na /
analyzed: gsum kas kyang khams cher mi bde ba dang / @291b sems gnas pa dus mtshungs par gyur na /
translated: If all three feel that their humors are very unbalanced, or that their minds are not in equipoise,

original: ye mi bsgom par ngal gso'o //
analyzed: ye mi bsgom par ngal gso'o //
translated: they should not meditate at all, but should rest.

original: khams sor ma chud kyi bar du yud tsam lta ba las thun du bcad pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: khams sor ma chud kyi bar du yud tsam lta ba las thun du bcad pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Until their humors are in balance, they should meditate in short sessions, looking up from time to time.

original: de ltar brtan pa'i thabs kyis brtan par byas pa'i dmigs pa de ngos gzung ba ni yid la byed pa dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar brtan pa'i thabs kyis brtan par byas pa'i dmigs pa de ngos gzung ba ni yid la byed pa dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: The identification of the object of meditation that has been stabilized by the method of stabilization is in accord with the mental attentions.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus,

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: the noble Sūtra of the Definitive Explanation of the Intention says:

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi //
translated: “What is that mental attention called whose object is not the attainment of physical and mental flexibility?”

original: byams pa zhi gnas dang mthun pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa zhi gnas dang mthun pa'i mos pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He has the devotion that is conducive to serenity,

original: zhi gnas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: but he does not have serenity.

original: gang zhig dri ma gsum gyis bsgribs pas na //
analyzed: gang zhig dri ma gsum gyis bsgribs pas na //
translated: He who is blinded by the three defilements

original: dmus long gyur pas sprul sku ma mthong la //🔽'di rtogs gong nas gong du gyur pa yis //
analyzed: dmus long gyur pas sprul sku ma mthong la // 'di rtogs gong nas gong du gyur pa yis //
translated: does not see the Emanation Body.🔽May he see it by the performance of this work,🔽which is the cause of seeing it, and which is the means of realizing it more and more.

original: de mthong bya phyir bgyis pas de mthong shog / zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i thabs cung zad bris pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: de mthong bya phyir bgyis pas de mthong shog / zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i thabs cung zad bris pa rdzogs so//
translated: This brief description of the means of entering into serenity is now completed.
